tweets.html:
dear pope: Im sorry VM fans stole ur thunder on ur 1st day. I mean,Im not really that sorry,but i thought it would be polite 2 say so. xo

— Kristen Bell (@IMKristenBell) March 14, 2013

What The Veronica Mars Kickstarter Means For The Future Of Television And Kickstarter And Veronicas And Kristen Bell's Unborn Child

— pilot (@pilotbacon) March 14, 2013

I think if the #VeronicaMarsMovie generates enough money, they should decide to film the ten worst VM fanfics they can find.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 14, 2013

Also, I think #VeronicaMars should have added a Kickstarter option where a donation of $1 million let you name Kristen Bell's unborn child.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) March 14, 2013

The ONLY bad thing about the "Veronica Mars" Kickstarter success are all the thinkpieces I'm going to have to read about what it "means."

— Stephen Falk (@stephenfalk) March 14, 2013

Kickstarter to pay for all the prizes and crap people need to be sent from the Veronica Mars Kickstarter.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) March 14, 2013

I love #VeronicaMars, but this makes you think how easy it would be to wipe out world hunger if people were actually motivated to do so.

— Greg Boyd (@Greg447) March 14, 2013

I was going to tweet "Kickstarter 3rd Rock from the Sun" ironically but then I realized I actually want to see Lithgow work w/an adult JGL.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) March 14, 2013

And Lo, The Joss Whedon Haters Did Appear, And Tweeted Angrily

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 15, 2013

From now on, I'm just going to carefully timed clips of Veronica Mars as responses to questions on Twitter.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 15, 2013

At what level of donation does Kristen Bell agree to go on a pizza date with me?

— Brandon Bird (@Brandon_Bird) March 15, 2013

While I loved the #VeronicaMarsMovie Kickstarter video, I have one question: Where's Wallace at? Where the f--- is Wallace? Huh? Thomas!

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) March 15, 2013

anyway, I hope someone kickstarts a Lost movie, because that'll end up HILARIOUS

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) March 15, 2013

@RowanKaiser Kickstarter for TONY SOPRANO IS NOT DEAD SHUT THE FUCK UP EVERYONE.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) March 15, 2013

@RowanKaiser @katherinemiller I anxiously await the arrival of Super PACs for TV Kickstarter projects.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 15, 2013

Sanctimonious much? RT @TMZ: Fans donate over $2 mil for “Veronica Mars” movie … why fight poverty or disease when you can get a film made.

— Scott Collins (@ScottCollins) March 15, 2013

Or run a cheezy gossip website! RT @TMZ:“Veronica Mars” movie … why fight poverty or disease when you can get a film made.

— Scott Collins (@ScottCollins) March 15, 2013

Whatever they're smokn' over at NBC the past few days..........I want me some.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) March 14, 2013

NBC is moving "Smash" to Saturday nights, where it will have lots of space to run and play with all the other "special" shows in TV lineups.

— Ben Siemon (@BenjaminJS) March 14, 2013

Do I owe Joss Whedon money every time something on Twitter makes me go "Grrr... Argh"?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 14, 2013

Deleted my series-link of #Glee and erased all episodes that had stacked up. Twelve-Step Program completed.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) March 14, 2013

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) March 14, 2013

Seth Cohen is not the perfect boyfriend. He is a neurotic nightmare.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 14, 2013

The perfect boyfriend is obviously Pacey Witter, duh.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 14, 2013

Never mind about #Survivor's ratings. CBS press release brags it "soars to season highs." So look for Brandon & Russell on S27.

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
Brandon's "I've never seen my uncle so proud of me" when talking about watching last night's episode is the saddest thing I've ever heard.

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) March 15, 2013

I'm watching "Nashville" for the first time. It must be authentic because the music makes me want to die.

— BUM CHILLUPS (@edsbs) March 15, 2013

Dear network television casting people: Taye Diggs and Blair Underwood are great, but other African-American actors also exist. No, really.

— Zack Stentz (@MuseZack) March 15, 2013

"The Americans" has taught me that during the '80s, 75% of all Americans slept w/at least one Soviet agent.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 15, 2013

Once in NY, I got a QTip stuck in my ear. Had to see a doctor. Never thought I could've turned that into to TV episode. #GirlsHBO

— Bobby Rivers (@BobbyRiversTV) March 15, 2013

According to TV, Americans only work as fashion designers, fashion judges, fashion stylists, cupcake makers or deep sea fishermen.

— JEN KIRKMAN (@JenKirkman) March 15, 2013

If you want to be a TV writer and learn about showing-not-telling, watch last night's #Southland.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) March 15, 2013

New Samsung phone automatically pauses a video when you look away because the Spectacle has won. #debord #doomed

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 15, 2013

The best part of the month before #MadMen is trying to figure out what completely unfounded prediction will look the silliest post-air date.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) March 15, 2013

This year, I'm pulling out the stops. Calling it now: body-snatchers. Everyone on that show is so _attractive_.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) March 15, 2013

MAD MEN spoiler: entire cast replaced by Lego mini-figures, Matthew Weiner moves them & does all the voices really high-pitched.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) March 15, 2013

@mattzollerseitz It's the most compelling Betty's ever been!

— Christopher Dole (@chrisdole86) March 15, 2013

MAD MEN spoiler: Mrs Blankenship is back... and she's hungry.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) March 15, 2013

In accordance with Matthew Weiner's wishes, my season six MAD MEN review will be a streaming video of a mime routine.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) March 15, 2013

Dear critics -- please stop with the fake Mad Men spoilers. We're already jealous, you don't need to taunt us too.

— Mike Stein (@MikeSteinOnline) March 15, 2013

I can't be the only one hoping Lena Dunham writes a HuffPo op-ed about Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's upcoming performance on "Splash".

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 14, 2013

Everyone's talking today about a movie of a low-rated TV show, and not that an #Idol judge was late on live TV. That's progress.

— Adam B. Vary (@adambvary) March 14, 2013

The wandering around the stage like a bunch of confused Sims is a nice touch. #Idol

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) March 15, 2013

The only thing that could make "Idol" Group Sings worse? Turning them into commercials. #MissionAccomplished

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 15, 2013

That was awfully nice of the mayor to not banish the contestant from her hometown. Also, way to dress up, your honor. #Idol

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) March 15, 2013

#IdolLovesHashtagsWayTooMuch

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) March 15, 2013

Has Seacrest successfully executed the double quadruple negative yet? #Idol

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) March 15, 2013

Ryan Seacrest is Carol Channing's last horcrux.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) March 15, 2013

"Hello good friends," Ryan Seacrest says as he kneels in his foyer and beetles crawl up his arms.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) March 15, 2013

Local news has footage of a mom giving her toddler a bong hit which is supposed to outrage me but I don't care as I have no relation to them

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 15, 2013

Weird, I don't REMEMBER signing up for monthly updates on how Carnival Cruise Ships is doing, news outlets

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) March 15, 2013

I think Nickelodeon "slimed" our basketball team before they went on the court. Those sure ain't ND colors. @NDProblems_

— CJ (@cj_condon) March 15, 2013

Notre Dame finally went and did it. They are wearing Digger Phelps' highlighter.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) March 15, 2013

I turned off the TV and I can still see Notre Dame's uniforms...

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) March 15, 2013

The most important thing we can learn from these Notre Dame uniforms is that you should never try anything because it will turn out awful.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) March 15, 2013

I'm way too angry at #Community for making a joke at The Tree of Life's expense.

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) March 15, 2013

Tonight's COMMUNITY has a TREE OF LIFE joke that makes me hate the entire episode on general principle. Fuck what this show has become.

— Peter Avellino (@PeterAPeel) March 15, 2013

"Best Community ever!" "Worst Community ever!" That's you guys.

— Andy Bobrow (@abobrow) March 15, 2013

I hope the person Chang is reporting to is Dan Harmon. #Community

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) March 15, 2013

My string of giving episodes of #Community a B- and then softly crying myself to sleep continues.

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) March 15, 2013

Tonight on #ParksAndRec: Ron Swanson learns about Kickstarter, gives a blank stare, and goes back to building chairs for fun.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 14, 2013

Of all the weirdly wrong things about Parks&Rec s1 - Andy being a douchebag, Ron not being 'Ron' yet, the weirdest is Retta's old lady hair.

— Faye Woods (@FayebellineW) March 15, 2013

Perd Hapley is the Armond White of Pawnee, PERDFECTION

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) March 15, 2013

Leslie Knope slams poetry slams: Reason #1,785 why I love @parksandrecnbc

— kentucker (@kentucker) March 15, 2013

That Ann Perkins line would play much differently on #BSG. Just saying. #ParksAndRec

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 15, 2013

The ladies of #ParksandRec are KILLING IT this season, hair-wise.

— TVmouse (@theTVmouse) March 15, 2013

Hey lets put a weird buttcrack in the middle of Rashida Jones head ~ Parks and Rec's hairstylist for some reason

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) March 15, 2013

APRIL IS SINGING "TIME AFTER TIME." MY WHOLE LIFE IS COMPLETE. #ParksandRec

— TVmouse (@theTVmouse) March 15, 2013

We found my new favorite girl group! #ParksandRec

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) March 15, 2013

Too funny to cancel #ParksandRec

— the TV Addict (@theTVaddict) March 15, 2013

Ironically, this P&R has convinced me that the government should give NBC's Thursday night comedy lineup a historical grant.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) March 15, 2013

Heart shirt is Leslie Knope. Leslie Knope is heart shirt.

— TVmouse (@theTVmouse) March 15, 2013

Jason Schwartzman is my favorite!!! My favorite WHAT, you ask? My favorite everything.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) March 15, 2013

Jean Ralphio making me laugh? What is this strange voodoo?! #ParksandRecreation

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 15, 2013

There are times I hope everything else on NBC prime time gets canceled so they have to keep making Parks and Rec forever. #timeaftertime

Correction: film snob jokes are the best when delivered by Jason Schwartzman. @K_Thrace1

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) March 15, 2013

I think "socialist hellscape" is my new favorite phrase. Thanks, Ron Swanson.

5 years, but Aubrey Plaza finally won me over. Wow.

— Bryan Murphy (@Bryan_Murphy) March 15, 2013

Just about any Wes Anderson character/actor would slip pretty seamlessly into #ParksandRec, huh?

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) March 15, 2013

"12 years. Time is a son of a bitch." The Office has been reading our tweets!
